reviewText: Just Cause 2 is an open - world game. There are 3 factions, which gives you different missions and dialogue. The 3 factions are: The Reapers, The Ular Boys, and The Roaches. You also have your main missions, which lead you to the ending (if it wasn't self - explanitory). But that isn't what makes the game super fun. You have a huge country to explore: Panau. After quite awhile, you unlock a bunch of badass equipment, vehicles, and even have an extraction helicopter that can bring you to places you already discovered. You can fly a plane from one corner of the world, to the opposite end of the world. There are boats, helicopters, ATV's, motorcycles, etc. And, how could I forget, the grappling hook. The grappling hook is used to do all kinds of things. When you skydive, if you plan your grappling hook properly, you can break your fall! You can latch on the enemies and pull them to you! Anyways, that's all I can explain. But this game's a blast. You should buy it; full price or not! JUST BUY IT! Final Verdict: 9.5/10.

reviewText:
Just Cause 2 is an impressive sandbox game with a gigantic map. It's pretty cool! I'll give it a review.

GAMEPLAY:
Just Cause 2's gameplay like a stereotypical action movie - turned up to eleven. It's got an open-world GTA-like format with cars, planes, guns, and boats. The map is HUGE. It makes Grand Theft Auto's playing field look tiny. If traversing a map this big sounds difficult, dno't worry - you play as a dude called Rico, who is basically the latino spiderman. As Rico, you can use your grappling hook as much as you like to grab onto anything and launch yourself in that direction. A really cool feature is that you can latch your grappling hook onto a car to hijack it extremely quickly. You can also do crazy stunts and deploy parachutes whenever you like. That's right - Rico basically farts parachutes. There's lots of guns, explosions, and all kinds of crazy things. You can do missions, but to unlock missions you must cause lots of chaos first - which is good because blowing up things while in police pursuit is EXTREMELY fun.

PRESENTATION:
The game is absolutely gorgeous. The island of Panau looks amazing and relaxing. The explosions are huge and dramatic. The gunplay looks cool and cinematic. There's not much I can really say about the graphics except that they look great in all aspects. Perhaps not the most realistic, but the game is a few years old, so it's to be expected. Music is nice but there's not much variety so it may get a bit repetetive.

STORY:
Not the game's strongest suit. The story is rather lacking compared to something like Fallout or Half-Life. Sure, it's there, but it's not pulitzer-prize caliber stuff. The story never gets in the way of the gameplay because it's really not that important.

I'd have to say that Just Cause 2 is definitely worth buying. It's fun and allows for hours of non-stop gameplay. If you like Grand Theft auto or similar open-world games, you should definitely try this one. Just cause 2 isn't perfect, but it is one big fun, explosion-packed adventure with tons of things to destroy and bad guys to defeat. Can't wait until Just Cause 3 comes out!

reviewText:
One of the most underrated and funny games I've ever played. Gorgeous graphics and non-stop action!

The story of the game is intentionally stupid, a homage to 80's action movies, full of one-liners and evil guys with awful aiming. Don't take it seriously because it's not what makes this game great. What makes it amazing is that the main objective of this game is to cause CHAOS, and there's a lot of ways to do it, which gives you a lot of place to improvise and have fun. Missions are OK, some are better than others, some are just a copy-paste of previous ones, but doesn't matter, all are fun. Even if you are not interested in completing you can have fun because there's a lot of other things to do like racing (air, road and even on water), find collectibles, destroy enemy bases, etc.

The map is HUGE and very detailed, you can play hundreds of hours and you will still find interesting places to visit.  Don't hesitate to buy it if you like sandbox games! is a MUST!

reviewText:
Just Cause 2 is a unique game which implements many features that no other game - at the time of release or now - has ever implemented.

Somewhat enjoyable, gameplay offers an extensive amount of amusement, when you get the hang of it that is. Jumping around with your grappling hook and parachuting from tree to tree to avoid gunfire is just one of the many aspects of this game that makes it notable.

Storyline is thin and will be finished quite promptly and unfortunately, once you've gotten to that point, it just loses its fun-value

The repetitiveness of the missions, atrocious voice acting, and overall lack of effort that seems to have been put into just about everything except fun game mechanics can leave a stale taste in one‚Äôs mouth. Flying around causing aimless chaos is fun for a few hours, but when you realize that's the only entertaining element the game has to offer you get bored quickly.

reviewText:
Very fun game.

If you dont want to be pushed into a story line, but want plot and action, along with guns, cars, planes, boats etc, this is your game.

Think GTA5. Three potential storylines (all playable simultaneously), can buy weapons and vehicles, lots of destruction, and cop chases.

The map is MASSIVE, i flew for 5 real time minutes, and i had barely crossed a quarter of the map.

The game is truly Open World, where you can assualt military bases and complete sections of the map at your own speed.

Weaknesses? Yeah, there are a few. AI is limited. Grappling hook has unrealistic reach, and some physics that are questionable.

Overall, a great game that doesnt take itself seriously, but presents a good, time consuming, action-filled third person shooter.

Can attach people to Oxygen tanks and shoot the tanks into the air. 10/10

reviewText: This is just one very great game. The controls are fluent and feel really nice. The missions are a bit repetitive apart from the story missions, which make up less than 20% of the game. You have to complete minor missions before you can progress in the story line. However, you only need a handful of minor missions to unlock all the story missions. That's the one major flaw in this game, it doesn't push you to do a lot of minor missions, you can rush through the story line is less than 15 hours. After that, there is a HUGE amount of sidemissions and collectibles to keep you busy. Not as much fun as the story but still well worth your time. The graphics are very nice, especially considering this game is a couple of years old already. Goes around on steam for less than 10 bucks, this one is a no-brainer for anyone loving shooting, action and an open world to explore.

reviewText:
Just Cause 2 is immense.  The gameplay of GTA but with a combat oriented missions.

If you love a secret agent themed story, the ability to use a myriad of weapons, boats, cars, bikes and places to cause untold destruction and havoc, this is the game for you.

One of the few games Ive spend 250+ hours playing, despite the repetitive gameplay, the action rarely gets boring.  The mission goals are coupled well achievements and together just keep you playing for one more mission longer.
Everything about the game screams quality, from the chessy voice-acting, the lush enviroment and settings, to the wonderfully rendered vehicles and characters.

This is not a serious game but, its full-bodied serious action is unique in the 200+ games Ive played.  An inperfect game, but definitely my favourite one of all time.

Unmissable!!

reviewText:
So I bought this game not really knowing what to expect. When it just came out, someone said it was awesome. And I gotta say, I am not dissapointed.

The game lacks realism on certain parts of the game, for example the grappling and the infinite parachutes. It is those things that makes the game awesome. It is a bit hard to get used to in the beginning of the game, but once you are used to it, you are glad you have it.

This game as a third person shooter is also a succes. Again, a bit difficult to get used to the dualwielding/single wielding hotkeys. The dual wielding is awesome in the middle of fights, because if you use it correctly, you aren't out of ammo most of the time.

No game is perfect, neither is this game. The stronghold takeovers are pretty repetitive, there aren't many of them, but all of them are the same: same goals, same order of objectives. The only difference is the difficulty.

The missions are mostly unique. I really enjoyed most of them. Some of them take a long time because it is a long mission or because some of them are kinda difficult. The shorter ones are usually pretty easy: Go there, do this and you are done. But there is a nice variety of missions.

Overall, if you like third person shooters and or weird games, then I strongly recommend this game. I haven't play multiplayer yet, so I don't know how good that is.

reviewText:
Just cause 2 is a fun game ‚Äì but its hard to quantify exactly why.

Just cause 2 is kind of like a ridiculous made-for-TV action movie.  The acting (or voice acting) is terrible.  The graphics are quite dated.  You can blow up a building with a couple of shots from your desert eagle.  You can basically fly using your tractor cable.

But the game is simply fun!  I don't usually like games that are too unrealistic.  But in this case I think the game works because the developers understood that it was meant to be an unrealistic and crazy action game.

Unfortunately, the game crashes frequently.  In 87 minutes of game play it has crashed on me 3 times with a ‚Äújust cause 2 has stopped working‚Äù message.  I'm not sure if it's because the game wasn't made for Windows 8 and is having compatibility issues or if it's just buggy.  However, the latter seems most likely as a quick Google search reveals a long list of bug complaints that have gone unfixed for years.  So for that reason I put the game at 3/5 stars.

Link to bugs http://justcause.wikia.com/wiki/Just_Cause_2_Bugs_and_glitches

reviewText:
It has an infinitely usable zipline.
Other than that, it's an action movie in game form. Filled with gunfights and explosions, you play as an American secret agent/black ops who goes and tears up a Southeast Asian dictatorship.
This comes in the form of an open-world(the map is huge) 3rd person shooter with: campaign missions; mini-missions done for revolutionary groups and mafias with simple escort, collect, hijack, destroy, and kill objects; races; military bases and cities with infastructure to destroy, leaders to kill, and upgrades to collect; sprinkled around the map.
Combat isn't too challenging, as you soak up any damage you can get. You can either: zip, roll, and jump around, whacking people, throwing around with your zipline, and shooting people; or do it the boring way.
You also got your cars, your boats, your helicopters, your planes, and your military veichles to use in it too.
You can also just raise some havoc, as in most open world games.
Voice acting is pretty bad, and the very large map isn't too exciting to explore.

reviewText:
Hands down the best open world game I've ever played. There's also a 3rd party multiplayer mod in development www.jc-mp.com
......
I'm a huge fan of open world games, from the original GTA way back in the 90's right up to it's latest incarnation GTAIV. I've also enjoyed Shenmue, Dragon Quest, Bully, Fallout, Farcry, Spiderman, Burnout, Arkham City..... any genre, any platform- it's easily my favourite type of gameworld. But the mechanics make a game and Just Cause 2 has the most fun mechanics I've ever played with. The possibilities are only limited to your imagination....... and skill.
......
Wanna steal a fighterjet? Cool, Rico can do that. Wanna fly that plane toward a bridge, jump on top and surf the jet under the bridge? Fine, Rico can do that. Wanna jump from a building flying through death defying gaps and before hitting the ground, release your parachute and walk away unharmed? Rico can do that one too. Really, once you get the hang of the controls the game comes to life in a way I've experienced in no other.
......
That would be my recommendation over if it wasn't for one final thing. Just Cause 2 Multiplayer. It's exactly what it sounds like and so much more. This is a mod that allows over 2000 players to join a single server, playing together on the same map. Nobody should allow themselves to ignore the fact that this really is a landmark in gaming. Never has a game of action orientated 3rd person shooting/jumping/driving been played on this scale. The closest would be something like GTAIV multiplayer on PC with up to 32 players. 2000+ Players is a whole new league above and beyond what I ever thought possible. You should try it > www.jc-mp.com

reviewText:
Absolutely recommend this game to people who love open world games with beautiful nature sights and atmosphere. The map is gigantic and has a lot of things to do in it, like taking over military bases and the corrupt government property by blowing the crap out of them until there's nothing left to destroy or just jumping around with your grapple hook and exploring the map with your parachute.
The main story is very interesting even though it's kinda short but once you complete it, there's still more than enough to do until you have reached a 100% completion of the game.
If you find yourself in the middle of a mountain or a desert, you can just call the black market dealer (Tom Sheldon) at any time and buy a vehicle or even guns from him. Not only can you buy them but you can even upgrade them with the vehicle/weapon parts that can be found and collected all over the map.
Helicopters with mounted rocket launchers and mini-guns, badass SUVs with mounted guns that can be operated by an ally or a rocket launcher that shoots 2 rockets per second or even a sniper rifle that will send your enemies a few feet in the air as you hit them, the choice of destruction is yours.
Annihilate, conquer and become a legendary hero who ends the corrupt dictatorship of Panau once and for all.

P.S. The map contains a lot of easter eggs!

reviewText:
Buy this game and play it.  That's pretty well all that needs to be said but I'll say a bit more.

The grappling hook in this game may be one of the single best/fun mechanics I've ever played with in a game.  Hooking vehicles, boats, planes and more together is just plain fun.  Using it while also shooting down some rag tag militia might be even more fun.

You get a fair share of vehicles and weapons to wreck mayhem everywhere.  There's also a lot of missions and story that keep you interested in causing more mayhem.  As well you get a gigantic island with lots of variety to the terrian and good deal of towns/cities to play in and cause further mayhem.

With all that mayhem you cause you may generate a fair amount of attention from the local authorities, but thats okay, cause using your grappling hook to get out of those situations is just as fun as when you used your grappling hook to get into the situation.

Get this game and enjoy the hell out of it like everyone else has.

reviewText:
Need an antidote to thinking games like Civ and Fate of the World? This is it.

Just Cause 2 is a stoopid action game with next to no story. But you know what? It doesn't need one. Even if the dialogue was written by Shakespeare, I doubt you'd even notice. You'd be far too busy blowin' sh!t up.

Use your Zelda style grapple-shot to leap around the Southeast Asian island of Panau lookin' for sh!t to blow up. Usually, anything with a big red star on it can be classified as sh!t - so blow it up!

What I love about this game the most is the sheer SIZE of the map. You have an entire country to explore and vandalise at your leisure. Use your hook-shot to nab a fighter jet out of the air for a quick travel solution. (Although I've never managed to 'land' a plane in this game, but maybe I'm missing the point slightly.)

Just Cause 2 is a silly, gravity-defying, ballsy, slightly-racist shoot'em up. And that alone makes it a great stressbuster. Jump in, find some sh!t, and BLOW IT UP!

Most of the time that I spent playing this game I was flying around with my parachute and driving cars of the bridge. The main story is perfectly balanced with the time you spend creating chaos in throughout the map. This is due to the fact that you must create a certain amount of chaos before you can start playing the next mission. I finished almost the entire videogame but not on steam, the main missions, the gangs mission. The only thing that I didnt complete were the collectibles, those pesky little items like drug drops or those funny skulls. Didn't care for those anybay. Still, all those hours were not wasted.

With the inclussion of multiplayer, everything is on a whole different scale. Playing with friends while on voice chat is very fun, except when there are people on the servers that start to annoy us by killing us with a helicoopter.

Worth it? Definitely

The game is short if you make it short. Sadly, I did this, but I still love it to death.

Throughout the game, you're pretty freaking overpowered, but you're still weak enough at the beginning for you to feel that growing power as you progress. You cause chaos in Panau Just Cause you can. The government is a corrupt totalitarian superpower that needs to be stopped, and you do that in the most fun way possible. You assassinate colonels, blow ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• up, and in general cause total societal collapse.

The fun is just so much more with the number of vehicles you can drive, including many different airplanes and helicopters. The Black Market is your way of buying weapons and vehicles or hitching a ride across the MASSIVE game-world you're playing in. You can explore this freaking huge world if you'd like, but not all of it is all that interesting, even if it's all beautiful.

This game is definitely worth the money.

reviewText:
Buy this game and play it.  That's pretty well all that needs to be said but I'll say a bit more.

The grappling hook in this game may be one of the single best/fun mechanics I've ever played with in a game.  Hooking vehicles, boats, planes and more together is just plain fun.  Using it while also shooting down some rag tag militia might be even more fun.

You get a fair share of vehicles and weapons to wreck mayhem everywhere.  There's also a lot of missions and story that keep you interested in causing more mayhem.  As well you get a gigantic island with lots of variety to the terrian and good deal of towns/cities to play in and cause further mayhem.

With all that mayhem you cause you may generate a fair amount of attention from the local authorities, but thats okay, cause using your grappling hook to get out of those situations is just as fun as when you used your grappling hook to get into the situation.

Get this game and enjoy the hell out of it like everyone else has.

reviewText:
Now that I've finally gotten around to finishing the main quest of this game, I feel I have enough information to write a review. It is a phenomenal game.

While the story is nothing to write home about and the controls can feel a bit wonky at times, the gratification that comes from grappling a jeep to the road and causing it to flip into the air or decimating harbors and army bases with a minigun are simply unmatched among games I've played.

This game's main gimmick" is your grappling hook that spits in the face of physics and basic logic. This 1 inch cord has enough power to hold a car to a helicopter without breaking and defies the concept of momentum
date: letting you jump off a skyscraper and grapple onto the road below without being harmed. The game also features a respectable arsenal of upgradable weapons and vehicles to terrorize the island nation of Panau with.\n\nThere are few negatives that I can come up with for this game

reviewText:
The isle of Panau offers much to the adventurer at heart. For you it offers a purity of form with regard to Just Cause 2's gameplay.

The first thing you'll notice with Just Cause 2 is how flowy everything is. From stealing cars to grappling on airplanes, to stealing an airplane while jumping from another airplane. All this is at the heart of Just Cause 2, and it really illistrates itself as Why did I just do that? Just cause...".

Action
recommended: chaos are at the heart of this game. Almost to it's detrement since the story tries to portray you as a liberator when you play as almost a conquerer.
